qas.question: What was Nigeria's third satellite called?
When was Nigeria's third satellite built?
When was Nigeria's third satellite launched?
When did Nigeria's third satellite run out of power?
where was Nigeria's third satellite launched?

context: <a0_0>NigComSat-1<a0_0/>, a Nigerian satellite built in <a1_0>2004<a1_0/>, was Nigeria's third satellite and Africa's first communication satellite. It was launched on <a2_0>13 May 2007<a2_0/>, aboard a Chinese Long March 3B carrier rocket, from the Xichang Satellite Launch Centre in <a4_0>China<a4_0/>. The spacecraft was operated by NigComSat and the Nigerian Space Agency, NASRDA. On <a3_0>11 November 2008<a3_0/>, NigComSat-1 failed in orbit after running out of power because of an anomaly in its solar array. It was based on the Chinese DFH-4 satellite bus, and carries a variety of transponders: 4 C-band; 14 Ku-band; 8 Ka-band; and 2 L-band. It was designed to provide coverage to many parts of Africa, and the Ka-band transponders would also cover Italy.
